alert.note: Alert for Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 22 at 10:38AM EST until December 24 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Greenville affecting Pitt County. For the Tar River...including Greenville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Greenville. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Widespread low land flooding adjacent to the river. Some farmland flooded across Pitt County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Friday was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM EST.
